resources.string: We have a menu down there

- Quick Add can (almost) read your mind
- Quick Add can figure out what you mean and pop the new event right onto your calendar.
- If you have a name of a location that includes a date or time word use quotation marks around the location name.
- If you enter a time with no date, Quick Add will create the event on the earliest date that puts the event in the future.
- If you do not enter a start time or end time, Quick Add will create an All Day event.
- If you do not enter an end time, Quick Add will create a one hour long event.
- You can specify start and end times using either time ranges or time intervals (for an hour,2:00-3 PM).
- Multi-day events can be specified using date ranges.
- If you would like someone added to the guest list, enter his or her email address or name(Will be looked up in your google contacts).
- Three-letter time zone abbreviations can be recognized following the time.
- Recurring events, the time expression has three parts: the start, the repetition, and the end.
- The start could be like (Monday at 8 AM).
- The repetition use keywords like (weekly,daily,monthly,yearly, every monday,...etc).
- The End could be like (for 3 weeks, for 9 days,...etc).
